comments.content:
Resembles Martin Majoor's [Seria Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20091119060156/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/seria-sans/bold/testdrive.html?s=BANG+%26+OLUFSEN&p=48) and [Nexus Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20091119060156/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/nexus-sans/bold/testdrive.html?s=BANG+%26+OLUFSEN&p=48) but neither of them have the ampersand.   
   
Edit: these fonts are nearly identical to my eye...

It seems the logo and particularly the ampersand are a redraw of the original logo, designed in 1931.   
   
 [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20091119060156/http:/www.beoworld.co.uk/logo.htm) is an article on it.   
   
Yves - when is the new typophile site gonna launch? My hair is going grey waiting for my posts to load!

The drawback in linking to FontFonts at MyFonts is that it requires   
the user to use more clicks to buy because it eventually sends   
them offsite to FontFont.com which is pretty antiquated and not   
as usable as FontShop.com. So if possible, I'd link to FontShop   
for all FFs.   
   
Patricia - About [FF Nexus](http://web.archive.org/web/20091119060156/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&font_categories_search=font_name_search&searchstr=FF%20Nexus) and [FF Seria](http://web.archive.org/web/20091119060156/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&font_categories=1&font_categories_search=font_name_search&searchstr=ff+seria): they are indeed   
very similar. Both from the same designer, Martin Majoor.   
 [FF Scala](http://web.archive.org/web/20091119060156/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&font_categories=1&font_categories_search=font_name_search&searchstr=ff+scala) is also similar, but with a larger x-height.   
The key differences lie in the fact that FF Nexus is newer,   
designed from the ground up in [three styles](http://web.archive.org/web/20091119060156/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=virtual.content&area=sf_fonts&content=fonts/ff35/index.html) (slab, serif, sans)   
and available in OpenType Pro with lots of features.

Patricia - consider yourself lucky you still got hair to go grey.   
I'm not that fortunate. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20091119060156im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
   
Frankly I don't know when version 2.0 is due. All I'm doing right   
now is trying to break it because once it's launched I'm not allowed   
to do that anymore. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20091119060156im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)

Stephen - I was looking for Nexus but couldn't remember the name, only that it was the same designer as Seria. I actually did go to Fontshop first but you don't list the designer (or I couldn't find it easily) so I ended up at Myfonts. Also, as Yves mentioned in an earlier post, I'd use your site a lot more often if you had a good keyword search.   
   
Yves, think of all the money you save on shampoo.
